reviews.text: We stayed at the Elaria Beach Resort for just one night as part of a GAP tour through Egypt and Jordan. May must have been low season, as our group of 15 formed perhaps a third of all the apparent guests, the remainder being Russian and German.
reviews.title: Lovely Nuweiba beach resort

likes.disliked: — Fairly isolated, but this can be a positive if you're getting away from it all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort itself and surrounding grounds are beautifully kept, as is the beach front. Nice pool area. Snorkelling is available nearby at the Hilton Resort. Food is standard international tourist buffet fare, executed reasonably well here. The hotel offered a meal-and-drink package for $25, which we thought was good value.
reviews.title: Very good stay

likes.liked: — The coral reef and the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We could have willing stayed several days more, and all agreed that this was the best hotel stay in our budget-priced tour by far.
reviews.title: Domina Elaria Nuweiba - a Brits-Eye view!

likes.liked: — Staff are always at your service and coral reef off the coast is amazing

reviews.title: Domina Elaria, New Hotel, Great place!!!
reviews.text: A side note: we subsequently took the ferry from Nuweiba to Aqaba, which was really to be avoided if you can. Worst travel experience in our trip!
